rComments: Best professor you'll ever have. Take as many courses with him as you can.

Prof Blair reminds me of a caring grandpa. He's very thorough during his lectures and goes over each case clearly - helps if you've been behind on readings - type verbatim what he says and BAM, there's your summary! Very, very fast replies on emails has a subtle dry sense of humour during lectures haha. Exam is fair and best one I did on in 1L.

Prof Blair is very kind but is a very, very boring lecturer. I barely learned anything in class (he uses class time to summarize cases, not to teach you why they're important to contract law). His exam was straightforward and fair. So, be prepared to read a lot and self-teach, or get an upper-year's summary
Goes through materials thoroughly and makes connections between different topics. Exam is straight-forward as long as you know the material and are prepared to write a lot.
Excellent lectures and coverage of material that is absolutely relevant to the practice of law.

Prof Blair covers the material in the syllabus and then some. He does a great job going through cases. He doesn't assume you know things that are not explained in the readings, so he will take the time to explain them to you, especially when they're more practical matters. Good sense of humour. Fair marker with good feedback. Exam TBD!

Professor Blair is arguably the best professor I've had in 1L. He teaches more clearly than any professor I've ever had, period. He is kind, always available to chat in his office hours about academics and otherwise. He gives fair feedback and doesn't slaughter you if your citations aren't perfect. He made me care about contract law.

Honestly one of the nicest profs I've ever had. I had no interest in his subject matter and don't have a business-minded brain, but he made everything clear and simple. Exam was very fair and he was always available to answer questions after class.

Well respected and admired by students/professors. Very tough marker. I had a B and C in two classes taken with him and otherwise excellent grades in law school. Often gives a 100% exam in two hours which is completely crushing if you can't finish the exam in time. Has a very warm side and enjoys mentoring and encouraging students to succeed!

Lectures are not exciting, but he does a good job of going through each case with the class. Not necessary to do all the readings - you can find good summaries online. The exam was fair. Very approachable if you have questions.

There is no better way to teach first year Contracts. Prof Blair the best professor I had in first year in the totality of circumstances. He was all I expected from a former partner of a great firm and more. He knows how to disseminate the law to novices. He kept our class on our toes but without applying too much pressure. He's also happy to help.

Please take Stephen Blair's Contracts class.  You may actually learn something substantive about law.  With other professors taking  a more theoretical approach (let's talk about why life's not fair - WAAAAHHH!!), it's nice to have a prof that simply teaches the material, using cases and using a modified version of the socratic method.  Love Him.

Blair is a super nice guy, very approachable, wants students to succeed and has a great sense of humour. Lectures are fun. If Mallet is on the far lest spectrum of great, Blair is on the far right. Would definitely recommend his classes.

Prof Blair is the Law Schools grandpa. He's phenomenal; take any class of his that you can. He assigns a LOT of cases (134 in commercial law) but he concisely reviews the cases. Don't overthink it, just take his class.
Commercial law. Messed up the exam, but he teaches you exactly what you need to know.

Professor Blair is the nicest, most helpful guy you'll ever meet. The subject matter is tough, by nature, and he's a black-letter prof, so don't expect many philosophical discussions of the law. He'll teach you what the law is, and contract law is sometimes (is usually) dry. It doesn't take long for his fantastic sense of humour to show, though.
Professor Blair uses pure socratic method which can be challenging at first. He is helpful if you visit his office. His exam was fair and interesting.

He's not clear on what he wants in terms of format for answers on the final but he's a great professor. Pretty much regurgietates his notes from previous years but there is no socratic, which is great.  He is very nice during office hours too! I would probably take other contracts courses with him
Easy going Prof, yet very professional.
Excellent Prof! Very helpful and clear! Definitely recommend!
He was by far my favourite teacher in 1L. So much so that I am taking other courses with him in 2L. Definitely go to his office hours. Nicest guy, and you never know what he can help you with.
Excellent Prof.  Great sense of humour and an excellent lecturer.  The exam was not easy but if you know your stuff, you will be fine. Highly recommend Commercial Law with Blair.

I had Blair for Contracts and Evidence - he is honestly the NICEST PROF in the entire faculty.  Don't get me wrong, he is NOT an easy marker, BUT, he is fair, his exams offer choice and he TEACHES THE LAW (not his opinion).  Dry humour makes dry topics funny and his reading lists are applicable to the class.  Highly recommend!!!

If only more profs were like Blair. He is fair and genuinely wants to help his students. His lectures are fun and he makes himself available outside of class time. The one critique is that the casebook will not be sufficient. You will need to buy a contract law treatise. I highly recommend Blair for Contract law.

Good Prof! Dedicated, clear in explanations, sometimes funny, fair in exam. By comparison with other profs, he is less theoretical and presentations are less structured. Yet, when reading your notes (somehow) the discourse is fluent and the explanations make sense.

Excellent prof. Blair is clear and straightforward in his teaching style (if a bit dry at times) and the final exam was fair. If you can get past having to do the partner paper, I would absolutely recommend him. The extra time in 1st semester that I got from having one less exam to study for was really useful too.

Nice guy who likes students and can be quite humourous at times. The only problem I find with him is that he assigns papers to be completed in partners and is unclear about his requirements and method of evaluation. If you take his class your mark may be penalised by someone else's shoddy work.

Prof. Blair is a very nice guy.    He is very approachable, funny, and thoughtful.  If you're looking for a critical perspective on tort law with lively class discussion, though, this is not the class to take.  He is very straightforward and by the book in his teaching.
Great Professor! (Super easy exam though!)
You simply must love the hair.

Avoid Blair if you can. One of the dullest profs. Granted, civ pro is not interesting to begin with; however, Blair makes an already boring topic even more unbearable. The expectations for the assgn'ts were unclear; he gave us examples of forms which were out-of-date, and then penalized us for using them in our assgn'ts.

Very approachable. However, does not really explain concepts. Relies too heavily on students to do this task. Expect to do double the work, as you'll need to rely on other textbooks (other than the case book, which is really not that helpful) that will better explain things. I wouldn't recommend him for a first-year law course; upper year, maybe.
Very helpful, approachable and encouraging. He creates a relaxed atmosphere in class. funny and cute too.
Super helpful. He has improved a lot. Great hair.
Blair is totally dedicated and very helpful, he is sometimes a little unclear/unsure. He has a great sense of humour and cares a lot about his students.
Helpful and friendly.  Lectures can be boring and unclear but he is super helpful during office hours.
Excellent class.  Lots of opportunities to improve speaking skills.  Super guy; very approachable.
